Module devon.inventorymanager
Package devon.inventorymanager

Class mainController

java.lang.Object
devon.inventorymanager.mainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class mainController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the Main controller class for the application. This class handles buttons for adding, deleting, and modifying. It also manages the display of parts and products in table views.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is the initialize method. This method is called during initialization it prepares the main view and fills the tables with data from the inventory. It also sets up the columns in the tables to display the correct information.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location of Main.fxml.
      resourceBundle - resources used for initialization.

    • onAddPartClicked

      public void onAddPartClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onAddPartClicked method. When someone clicks the Add Part button on the screen, this method gets called. It loads the Add Part screen in the same window replacing what was there.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by clicking the add part button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If and input/output error occurs during scene loading.

    • ondeletePart

      public void ondeletePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the ondeletePart method. When the Delete Part button is clicked the selected part is deleted. When someone clicks the Delete Part button this method is called. This method checks if a part is selected in the parts table. If no part is selected nothing happens. If a part is selected, it shows a confirmation popup asking if you want to delete the part. If the user confirms, the selected part is deleted.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by clicking the delete part button.

    • onModifyPart

      public void onModifyPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onModifyPart method. It Handles actions when the modify part button is clicked. When modify part button is clicked and a part is selected the modify part screen is loaded. The modify part screen is loaded and filled with the selected part data.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event generated by clicking the modify part button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input/output error occurs during scene loading.

    • onDeleteProduct

      public void onDeleteProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onDeleteProduct method. When the delete product button is pressed the selected product is deleted.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by clicking the delete product button.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input/output error occurs during scene loading.

    • onModifyProduct

      public void onModifyProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onModifyProduct method. This method handles when the Modify product button is clicked to edit a product. This method gets activated when someone clicks the modify product button. The button click is represented by the action event parameter. When this method is called it makes the app show a screen where you can change the details of a product.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event generated by clicking the modify product button.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input/output error occurs during scene loading.

    • onExit

      public void onExit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the Exit method. This method is called when the exit button is clicked on the user interface. It obtains the current application stage and closes it shutting down the application.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by clicking the exit button.

    • onaddProduct

      public void onaddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the addProduct method. This method is called when the Add Product button is clicked. It loads the Add Product screen so the user can create a new product.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by clicking the add product button
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onPartsSearch

      public void onPartsSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onPartsSearch method. This method is called when the user presses the enter key after entering part name or id in the part search text field.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated when the user presses the enter key
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onProductSearch

      public void onProductSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the onProductSearch method. This method is called when the user presses the enter key after entering the product name or id in the product search text field.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event generated when the user presses the enter key
      Throws:
      IOException
